Love space but nervous to travel 1.8 billion miles? That’s okay!

Leave your mark by having your name engraved on the 
@EuropaClipper
 spacecraft! 

#SendYourName here: https://go.nasa.gov/449nDLd

There’s space for everyone this #PrideMonth, and we’re celebrating the LGBTQI+ employees who help us reach for the stars, examine humanity’s place in the universe, and study our home planet: http://go.nasa.gov/3C9ncnU

Hurricane season in the Atlantic begins today. Our unique perspective from space allows us to study storms and their evolution, providing data to support forecasting and disaster responses: https://go.nasa.gov/3fYNZYE

I just reached a milestone only surpassed by Opportunity: 30 km on Mars   

I've explored so much in my 10-plus-year trek through Gale Crater, but there are many more rocks to sample and analyze! Retrace my tracks with this interactive map: http://go.nasa.gov/3EtmSCi

The diversity of our NASA team is what brings different perspectives to our missions, and we celebrate and share their stories. To protect our people from personal attacks, we have decided to limit comments on this post.

This month and every month, we recognize the achievements and contributions of our Asian American, Native Hawaiian, and Pacific Islander workforce.

Check out the gallery and celebrate #AANHPIHeritageMonth with us: https://go.nasa.gov/3MHtxf9
Live from @LibraryCongress: U.S. Poet Laureate Ada Limón reveals her Poem for Europa, an original work that will fly aboard the @EuropaClipper spacecraft to Jupiter's icy moon.
LIVE: Join NASA and @BoeingSpace officials as we share an update on the first #Starliner Crew Flight Test. Tune in.

@NASA and @BoeingSpace will host a media teleconference at 5pm ET today for an update on Boeing's first crewed flight on the CST-100 Starliner to the @Space_Station.

Listen in: http://nasa.gov/live

LIVE: Experts at @NASA_Johnson are discussing our upcoming spacewalks, scheduled for June 9 and June 15, to set up new solar arrays outside the @Space_Station.

We're taking questions from media and the public—share your spacewalk Qs with #AskNASA.

Join us and @LibraryCongress as U.S. Poet Laureate Ada Limón reveals her poem for the @EuropaClipper mission. The poem will be engraved on the spacecraft, and travel 1.8 billion miles (2.89 billion kilometers) to an icy moon of Jupiter. 

Tune in: https://bit.ly/42eJZJO

Victor Glover: captain, pilot, astronaut.

Glover most recently served as the pilot of the NASA 
@SpaceX
 #Crew1 mission and will be one of four astronauts flying aboard the #Artemis II mission around the Moon. https://go.nasa.gov/31cfXJh

Celebrate #MilitaryAppreciationMonth.

Hey, you: Get a load of this cloud! High-altitude ice clouds (like this one) can help regulate Earth's temperature by reflecting energy from the Sun.

A new 
@NASAEarth
 mission called PoISIR aims to study them in greater detail to improve climate forecasts. https://go.nasa.gov/3IAfgjj

14 years ago, 
@Astro_Mike
 wrote the first tweet from space. Since then, we’ve been sharing snippets of our life in orbit—and what it’s like to gaze upon our home planet.

Follow along: http://nasa.gov/astronauts/biographies/active…

This 
@NASAWebb
 image of the Pillars of Creation helps astronomers determine how stars form. Plus, it makes pretty sweet digital wallpaper.

Download high-resolution images from https://webbtelescope.org.
